 Details of today's complex Al-Qassam ambush against an Israeli outpost in Gaza:
‚Äì A unit of 18 Hamas fighter emerged from a tunnel near a temporary IDF outpost in southern Khan Younis.
‚Äì The unit jumped over the dirt barrier and entered the outpost, targeting several Israeli Merkava IV tanks with Yassin-105 RPGs and IEDs from close range.
‚Äì One of the fighter managed to snipe the commander of a Merkava IV tank, fatally injuring him.
‚Äì Subsequently, the fighters began assaulting a building that housed IDF troops, with machine gun fire, grenades and RPGs.
‚Äì The unit then entered the building, killing severel Israeli soldiers at point-blank range, while also losing several of their own fighters in the process.
‚Äì When an Israeli rescue force arrived, the last Al-Qassam fighter emerged from a tunnel and blew himself up amidst the soldiers, leading to casualties.
‚Äì Lastly, the Al-Qassam Brigades fired mortar shells upon the entry and exits of the outpost, cutting off supply lines and preventing easy evacuation.
@Middle_East_Spectator

Approximate paths of the Russian missiles over Ukraine last night.
The following was used:
~12 Kh-101 cruise missiles, launched from 2 Tu-95MS in Engels District, Saratov Oblast).
~12 Kalibr cruise missiles, launched from 1 "Varshavyanka"-class submarine and 1 "Admiral Makarov"-class frigate in the Black Sea, off the coast of Anapa, Krasnodar Krai. 
4 Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles launched from 4 MiG-31Ks east of Lipetsk City, Lipetsk Oblast.
1 Zircon hypersonic cruise missile launched from Cape Chauda, Crimea. 
Interception rates are unknown, but 2 Kh-101s are known to have been shot down over Kyiv Oblast. 
Over 500 Geran-2 drones were also launched in several waves from several locations surrounding Ukraine. 
The targets of the missiles were: 
Mukachevo, Zakkarpatia Oblast.
Zaporizhzhia City, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Lviv City, Lviv Oblast.
Lutsk, Volyn Oblast.
Dubno, Rivne Oblast.
Sumy City, Sumy Oblast.
Geran-2 drones targeted the above cities, as well as:
Pavlohrad, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Vinnytsia City, Vinnytsia Oblast.
Okhtyrka, Sumy Oblast.
Rivne City, Rivne Oblast.
Mezhova, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pokrovske, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.

Approximate paths of the Russian missiles over Ukraine last night.  The following was used:  ~12 Kh-101 cruise missiles, launched from 2 Tu-95MS in Engels District, Saratov Oblast).  ~12 Kalibr cruise missiles, launched from 1 "Varshavyanka"-class submarine‚Ä¶

One of the targets of last night's combined Russian missile strike was the Flextronics plant owned by the U.S. company "Flex", in Mukachevo, Zakarpattia Oblast. As many as 12 Kalibr cruise missiles impacted the plant, resulting in a massive fire breaking out. 
The plant has been operating in Mukachevo for over 13 years and was originally built for civilian purposes.

One of the targets of last night's combined Russian missile strike was the Flextronics plant owned by the U.S. company "Flex", in Mukachevo, Zakarpattia Oblast. As many as 12 Kalibr cruise missiles impacted the plant, resulting in a massive fire breaking out. 
The plant has been operating in Mukachevo for over 13 years and was originally built for civilian purposes.

Last night, Russian Kh-101 cruise missiles and Geran-2 drones struck the "Concern Electron" plant in Lviv City. The full extent of the damage is unknown. 
This plant was previously targeted on July 12, 2025.
Coordinates: 49.842332, 24.002155
Edit: I'm aware the geolocation proof is wrong. The coordinates are correct though.

Last night, 3-4 Russian Kh-101 cruise missiles impacted the Motor Sich Plant in Zaporizhzhia City. 
Locals report that Building 113 was the main target, which was used for producing engines for aircraft, drones and other light aviation. A large fire broke out afterwards.

Russian forces have captured the village of Bezsalivka, Bilopillya direction, Sumy Oblast. 
Pre-war population: ~60.
Total land area: ~0.62km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the town of Shcherbynivka, Kostyantynivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~3,266.
Total land area: ~5.92km¬≤.

Ukrainian forces have re-established control over the village of Andriivka-Klevtsove, Prosyana direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~777.
Total land area: ~3.66km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Novoheorhiivka, Pokrovske Direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~34.
Total land area: ~0.25km¬≤

If you currently live in Ukraine or Russia and feel comfortable with getting in contact with me, please DM me. I‚Äôm looking to increase the scope of my sourcing and reliability of the information I provide, especially on Russian and Ukrainian attacks. 
You will remain anonymous, and in complete control of the information you choose to provide, and how you provide it. I will only publish information that you allow me to, and that doesn‚Äôt put anyone from any side at risk. This will be extremely beneficial to my reporting. 
My telegram account: 
@AMK_Mapping1
. I also have Signal if you prefer that.

Syria Says No ‚ÄòCorridor‚Äô For Druze As More Crimes Are Unveiled (+18 Photos, Videos)
There will be no ‚Äúcross-border humanitarian corridor‚Äù to al-Suwayda, a Syrian official told the state-run Syrian Arab News Agency (SANA) on August 20, effectively denying recent reports of a plan to ship aid directly from Israel to Druze in the southern Syrian governorate.
Israel intervened in al-Suwayda last month, stopping an attack on the governorate by the forces of Syria‚Äôs Islamist-led interim government and affiliated Bedouin tribes.
The intervention, which granted Druze de-facto control over much of the governorate, was justified by Israel‚Äôs historic relationship with its own Druze community.
Since then, the government put al-Suwayda under siege, allowing the entry of limited supplies each day. Reports later revealed a plan backed by the United States, which brokered a ceasefire in the governorate, to open an aid corridor from Israel to al-Suwayda.
Read more: 
HERE

BEYOND THE BATTLEFIELD: WHY RUSSIA IS BOMBING AZERBAIJANI OIL IN UKRAINE

Ukrainian Secret Service Strives To Use Russian Pensioners As Suicide Bombers
Using elderly people for terrorist purposes is evidence of the weakness and desperation of the Kiev regime, particularly the Ukrainian intelligence services. Although such methods are vile and cruel, they will not succeed in destabilizing Russian society, which has faced much terrorism perpetrated by the Ukrainian side.
Russia‚Äôs Federal Security Service (FSB)¬†accused¬†the Security Service of Ukraine, the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, and Ukrainian nationalist structures of recruiting elderly Russian women as suicide bombers through online fraud and psychological manipulation.
According to the FSB, five elderly women were tricked into selling their homes and losing their savings via calls on Telegram and WhatsApp. The women were then allegedly instructed to track the homes and vehicles of Russian servicemen and deliver improvised explosive devices disguised as household items.
Read more 
HERE

In Video: Russian Geran Drone Hit Ukrainian HIMARS Launch Site
The Russian military has targeted a forest where Kiev forces deployed a United States-made M142 HIMARS multiple rocket launcher with Geran suicide drones.
The system carried out a launch from the small forest, located near the settlement of Rohivka in the Chernihiv direction, before getting detected. The launch site was quickly then targeted with at least two Geran drones. Footage of the strike posted to social networks on August 20 showed multiple secondary explosions after the strike. Rocket pods were clearly destroyed, although the fate of the launcher remains unclear.
Read more 
HERE

Long Arm of War: Russian Missiles Shatter Ukrainian West In One Of Most Devastating Attacks
In the dead of night on August 21, 2025, the skies over Ukraine erupted in what appears to be one of the most massive and sophisticated air assaults since the beginning of the conflict. Russian armed forces executed a powerful, multi-wave combined attack, leveraging almost a full spectrum of its aerial arsenal in a coordinated operation designed to overwhelm Ukrainian defenses and cripple critical national infrastructure.
The scale of the offensive was unprecedented. According to Ukrainian reports, Russian forces launched a total of 614 air attack assets. This immense armada included 574 Geranium/Shahed-type kamikaze drones, deployed in swarms to saturate and exhaust air defense systems. They were followed by a precise and devastating barrage of 40 missiles of virtually every class in Russia‚Äôs inventory.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Is Hunting Down Ukraine‚Äôs Remaining CAESAR Howitzer 
The Russian military is hunting down Ukraine‚Äôs remaining French-made CAESAR self-propelled howitzers with much success.
On August 20, two videos showing the destruction of two such howitzers surfaced online. Both howitzers were struck in the Dnipropetrovsk direction. One was targeted with a Lancet loitering munition, while the other was hit by multiple VT-40 FPV suicide drones.
Manufactured by France‚Äôs Nexter Systems, the CAESAR is a 155 mm 52-caliber howitzer mounted on a six-wheeled or eight-wheeled truck chassis. The howitzer can fire up to six rounds per minute and has a firing range of around 42 kilometers using extended range, full bore shells, and up to 55 kilometers using rocket assisted shells.
Read more 
HERE

Military Situation In Palestine On August 21, 2025 (Map Update)

Ukrainian Troops Are Helping Russian Army Strike Nationalist Barrier Detachments 
The AFU, or at least some of its units, are now clearly in an intra-conflict with the NGU‚Äôs barrier detachments (National Guard of Ukraine). The recent incidents shows a growing trend where Ukrainian troops are favoring the option of cooperating with the Russian military in order to get a chance to withdraw and save their lives.
On August 8, it was reported that Russian airstrikes destroyed two such detachments near the settlements of Orestopol and Alekseevka of the Dnipropetrovsk region after receiving information from the 31st Brigade of the AFU.
Another incident was reported by Russian media on August 14, in which the AFU‚Äôs 60th Brigade reported the coordinates of the command post responsible for the operations of barrier detachments deployed in the Donetsk direction to the Russian military. 
(Video) Ukrainian barrier detachment opened fire on soldiers evacuating from a trench stormed by Russian troops.
